t: Not*pn to us, Lord,*s not to us but*ld to your name be the glory, because*ld of your love and faithfulness.
Why*pn do the nations say, “Where*ld is their God?”
Our*ln God is in heaven; he*ld does whatever pleases him.
But*ln their idols are silver and gold, made*ld by human hands.
They*ln have mouths, but cannot speak, eyes,*ld but cannot see.
They*ln have ears, but cannot hear, noses,*ld but cannot smell.
They*ln have hands, but cannot feel, feet,*ld but cannot walk, nor*ld can they utter a sound with their throats.
Those*ln who make them will be like them, and*ld so will all who trust in them.
All*pn you Israelites, trust in the Lord—*s he*ld is their help and shield.
House*ln of Aaron, trust in the Lord—*s he*ld is their help and shield.
You*ln who fear him, trust in the Lord—*s he*ld is their help and shield.
The*pn Lord*s remembers us and will bless us: He*ld will bless his people Israel, he*ld will bless the house of Aaron,
he*ln will bless those who fear the Lord—*s small*ld and great alike.
May*pn the Lord*s cause you to flourish, both*ld you and your children.
May*ln you be blessed by the Lord,*s the*ld Maker of heaven and earth.
The*pn highest heavens belong to the Lord,*s but*ld the earth he has given to mankind.
It*ln is not the dead who praise the Lord,*s those*ld who go down to the place of silence;
it*ln is we who extol the Lord,*s both*ld now and forevermore. Praise*pn the Lord.*s
